DataElement.preferredName: Person Tuberculosis Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response that asks if the patient has a background of a chronic, recurrent infection caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis (TB).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Tuberculosis Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._A chronic, recurrent infection caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Tuberculosis (TB) may affect almost any tissue or organ of the body with the lungs being the most common site of infection. The clinical stages of TB are primary or initial infection, latent or dormant infection, and recrudescent or adult-type TB. Ninety to 95% of primary TB infections may go unrecognized. Histopathologically, tissue lesions consist of granulomas which usually undergo central caseation necrosis. Local symptoms of TB vary according to the part affected; acute symptoms include hectic fever, sweats, and emaciation; serious complications include granulomatous erosion of pulmonary bronchi associated with hemoptysis. If untreated, progressive TB may be associated with a high degree of mortality. This infection is frequently observed in immunocompromised individuals with AIDS or a history of illicit IV drug use._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Tuberculosis Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A chronic, recurrent infection caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Tuberculosis (TB) may affect almost any tissue or organ of the body with the lungs being the most common site of infection. The clinical stages of TB are primary or initial infection, latent or dormant infection, and recrudescent or adult-type TB. Ninety to 95% of primary TB infections may go unrecognized. Histopathologically, tissue lesions consist of granulomas which usually undergo central caseation necrosis. Local symptoms of TB vary according to the part affected; acute symptoms include hectic fever, sweats, and emaciation; serious complications include granulomatous erosion of pulmonary bronchi associated with hemoptysis. If untreated, progressive TB may be associated with a high degree of mortality. This infection is frequently observed in immunocompromised individuals with AIDS or a history of illicit IV drug use.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A chronic, recurrent infection caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Tuberculosis (TB) may affect almost any tissue or organ of the body with the lungs being the most common site of infection. The clinical stages of TB are primary or initial infection, latent or dormant infection, and recrudescent or adult-type TB. Ninety to 95% of primary TB infections may go unrecognized. Histopathologically, tissue lesions consist of granulomas which usually undergo central caseation necrosis. Local symptoms of TB vary according to the part affected; acute symptoms include hectic fever, sweats, and emaciation; serious complications include granulomatous erosion of pulmonary bronchi associated with hemoptysis. If untreated, progressive TB may be associated with a high degree of mortality. This infection is frequently observed in immunocompromised individuals with AIDS or a history of illicit IV drug use.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of TB (even if treated), evidence of active or latent TB or positive TB skin test (e.g. PPT)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of TB (even if treated), evidence of active or latent TB?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known history of previous clinical diagnosis of tuberculosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known history of active tuberculosis (TB)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known history of active TB (Bacillus Tuberculosis)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of tuberculosis treatment within the 2 years prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active tuberculosis (TB) or atypical mycobacterial infection including patients who are undergoing systemic antibiotics for active mycobacterial infection and patients with TB immune reconstitution syndrome (IRIS) requiring corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known history of active tuberculosis (TB)?
